subject: Re: AW: [junit] JUnit & Ant
msgSnippet: Good article fro IBM s developersWorks: Incremental development with Ant and JUnit Using unit test to improve your code in small steps
messageBody:
Good article fro IBM's developersWorks:

Incremental development with Ant and JUnit
Using unit test to improve your code in small steps

http://www-106.ibm.com/developerworks/library/j-ant/



"Kurt, Oliver" wrote:

> I'm using this one:
>
> <target name="test" depends="compile">
>
> <mkdir dir="${buildreports}"/>
>
> <junit printsummary="no" haltonfailure="no">
>
> <classpath>
> <pathelement location="${build}" />
> <pathelement path="${java.class.path}" />
> </classpath>
>
> <batchtest todir="${buildreports}">
> <fileset dir="${src}">
> <include name="**/*Test*.java" />
> </fileset>
> <formatter type="xml" />
> </batchtest>
>
> </junit>
> </target>
>
> -----Ursprungliche Nachricht-----
> Von: Yishay Mor [mailto:ymor@cisco.com]
> Gesendet: Donnerstag, 28. Juni 2001 14:36
> An: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Betreff: [junit] JUnit & Ant
>
> I'm looking for an example Ant build.xml which utilizes the JUnit task (if
> its really good, place it in the files section).
>
